intro: Sisymbrium planisiliquum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed shepherd's purse, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves and small white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its fruits are pods that split open to release seeds, a characteristic typical of the mustard family. Sisymbrium planisiliquum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields.
